fields.description:
With the latest SourceTree beta, the old bookmarks view is gone.  The new replacement using the + button is much more cumbersome. 

Please bring back the old Bookmarks view.

Also, there is a bug in this new repo selector in that rearranging repos by drag and drop doesn't work.  I drag one repo above another and the dragged repo gets moved somewhere near the bottom of the list.  (its not the exact bottom, so I couldn't say what is actually going on here)
fields.summary: Bring back the bookmarks view

fields.description:
# Open a repo
 # Open a terminal and type:
{code:java}
git worktree add ../test{code}

 # Open a new tab and attempt to add the worktree as a working copy. 

Result: The File Staus / Branches pane on the left never loads. The spinner spins for ever. 

Clicking the Log / History tab causes a crash. 

This worked fine in the previous beta.
fields.summary: Can't open any worktrees
Cannot copy path of file using CTRL+C

fields.description: This occurs when using Sourcetree for windows. Attempted to Push to Gerrit and the process never completed.
fields.summary: When pushing to Gerrit, the Sourcetree Progress Bar never completes

fields.description:
This done on Sourcetree for Windows (1.9.10.0).

Scenario:
Add a new file "test.txt" to master and commit.
Delete file "test.txt" and commit to master.
Create and checkout a new branch ("other") based on the commit which added test.txt (before the modification).
Modify test.txt and commit this to "other".

Now attempt to merge master (which has the file deleted) into the "other" branch.

The Visual Merge In Progress window appears - but nothing happens after that. The merge tool does not get invoked. Giving up and eventually pressing abort also leaves the temporary files used by the merge (test_BACKUP, test_BASE, test_LOCAL, test_REMOTE).

Open the terminal and enter git mergetool test.txt (ensure you have a mergetool configured).

Note that it sits on a prompt:
$ git mergetool test.txt
Merging:
test.txt

Deleted merge conflict for 'test.txt':

\{local}

: modified file

\{remote}

: deleted
Use (m)odified or (d)eleted file, or (a)bort?

I assume this prompt is where Sourcetree is hanging as well. I have attached zip file containing the repo where the merge can be attempted.
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs resolving merge conflict where one side deleted the file

fields.description:
1. Launch SourceTree after configuring it with your local Git repo
2. In the list of changes that appears, drag the Author column so it's the second column (so it's between Graph and Description).
3. Quit SourceTree
4. Launch SourceTree

Now the Author column is back to default position (after Description)
fields.summary: SourceTree does not save custom column order in commit window.

fields.description: When using the sort option "Path alphabetically" files are sometimes sorted in a non-path-alphabetical way".  Sometimes it seems like it's sorting by file names instead (I had one path zhs-CHS/C.xml" which was by another file C.xml").  It may be related to files that are modified after the sort has been applied.
fields.summary: Pending Files, sorted by path doesn't always keep sorting

fields.description: After each update/upgrade of SourceTree, the commit text links of all my projects are missing and I have to re-add them. This is really annoying if you have a couple of repositories in SourceTree. As long as there aren't global commit text links I have to re-add them to each repository separately.
fields.summary: Missing commit text links after each upgrade

fields.description: Double clicking in empty space on title/menubar should toggle maximize/previous size. Currently nothing happens on double-click in empty space on title/menubar
fields.summary: Doubleclick on Titlebar/Menubar should toggle maximize

fields.description:
Within Log/History panel:

 

Selecting a commit in the history the subwindow containing the affected files is updated (see {color:#14892c}green circles{color} on screenshot) but the subwindow describing the commit (containing the commit message) is NOT updated. The contents still refers to the currently checked out commit (see {color:#ff0000}red circles{color})
fields.summary: Window with commit information is not updated

fields.description:
I can move the mouse around and it changes, which means controls are there, just not painted. I can click where the main menu should be and the menu dropdowns are shown (see screenshot attached).

!SourcetreeHighContrast.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree window completely white when Windows theme is High Contrast

fields.description: After I opened a bookmark from the new tab list, I'm not able to open a second repository. Neither with double click nor from the context menu.
fields.summary: Not able to open multiple bookmarks

fields.description: Thanks for the new bookmark browser. It helps finding my repositories a lot! But please assign a shortcut to be able to open the new tab with the keyboard and not having to use the mouse. I have to restart SourceTree to be able to open another repo.
fields.summary: Define shurtcut key for new tab

fields.description: Please adjust the width of the tabs to their text. It is really hard to find the right repo due to cropped text and having others with small text width taking to much space.
fields.summary: Adjust the width of tabs to their text

fields.description:
Adding new folders is not as smooth as it could be. For example, hardly anyone wants to keep a folder named "New Folder 1" ;)

*Creation improvements*
 # Please set the focus to the newly created folder
 # Please put it into edit mode

*Editing improvements*
 # Allow F2 to rename the folder
 # Allow double click on the text to rename the folder
 # Select all text automatically when renaming
fields.summary: Folder management improvements in SourceTree 2.0

fields.description:
To reproduce, follow these steps:
 # Open a repository with a submodule
 # Double click on the submodule to open that repository

*Current behavior*

Current tab gets replaced by the submodule repository

*Expected behavior*

Submodule repository gets opened in a new tab
fields.summary: When opening a submodule, please create a new tab

fields.description: The current behavior has a greyed out checkbox for "Display a column guide" unless you choose "Use fixed-width font". It might make sense to add this as a suboption instead of greying out a choice that depends on another.
fields.summary: Create suboption "Display a column guide" under "Use fixed-width font"

fields.description:
After installing 2.0 beta version and opening a repository with subtree links, the sourcetreeconfig file in the .git directory is re-written and removes the links to all subtrees.

How to reproduce:
 # In SourceTree 1.9.20, add subtree links.
 # Start SourceTree 2.0.7 and open the repository

Expected result:

The subtree links should still be visible.

Actual result:

The links are not available because the sourctreeconfig file is overwritten every time you open SourceTree.
fields.summary: Subtree links removed after upgrade

fields.description:
I run the Distributed.net (dnet) client, crunching the OGR project with otherwise stock configurations (can provide the file if it'd help).

Many SourceTree operations tend to be very slow when the dnet client is running. I often have to pause dnet prior to performing SourceTree related tasks.

Based on my observations, it seems most of the slowness is around git related operations. I suspect that these external program calls are set to execute with a low (lowest?) affinity which cause it to be on par with the dnet client. Thus you have a very CPU hungry dnet competing with the git call, causing git to take a long time to execute.
fields.summary: Low Performance when Running Distributed.net

fields.description:
I'd like to make a feature suggestion for the new improved version.

I often works with multiple origins because I do merge between branches of different origins.

 

Because the commits list became chaotic with multiple branches of multiple origins, my idea is to allow to show or hide all the branches of the same origin.

Like right-click on the remote origin and select show/hide
fields.summary: Show/Hide remote branches for entire origin

fields.description:
We use SourceTree with Git repo connected to remote repo protected by HTTPS Client Authentication (each user has own SSL client certificate in PEM format).

 

We have constantly a popup to enter password of sslkey (see sceenshot "popup_password_prompt.png").

SourceTree should remember sllkey password.

 

PS: We can not save password via "Edit Host Account" panel (see screenshot: "unable_save_password.png")
fields.summary: Ability to remember Client Cert (sslkey) Password

fields.description: It takes time to find the right repository if the list is long, would be nice to have opportunity to search for local repos and branches as it is in GitHub for Windows app.
fields.summary: Add opportunity to search for local repos and branches

fields.description:
Sometimes it happens the {{ssh-agent.exe}} process takes to much CPU (about 33% on my Intel i5 2.5GHz) and I have to restart the SourceTree. Note, I have authentication by the ssh key, so maybe disabling the ssh-agent.exe would help, see SRCTREEWIN-6154.

 

Similar problems is reported for the GitHub, too, see [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26547024/github-for-windows-ssh-agent-exe-using-high-cpu-100-disk] And check the {{moggizx}} comment about the SourceTree - upvoted 6 times.
fields.summary: ssh-agent.exe taks to much CPU

fields.description: Demostration: https://youtu.be/09tDRH7H068
fields.summary: Unable update embedded git
Bugsplat Crash - Unable to anayze

fields.description:
We found a problem in mergettol with files having spaces on name:
the command that opens the mergetool didn't recognize files with spaces on name and then truncate the name which leads into a "file doesn't exists".

As the problem is on directory name, we changed the name of the directory, putting out the spaces. Then, when we try to perform a pull, a merge conflict appears but couldn't start because one of the files is on the directory with the space and the other in the directory without spaces.. which leads in merge command hangs and can't open the files.

This doesn't happens in older version of ST.
fields.summary: Conflict in mergettol with files having spaces on name

fields.description: the link is broken and not working
fields.summary: broken link

fields.description:
SourceTree constantly refreshing the log view (commit information section) making it very hard to review information about commits.
The view is refreshed all the time even when there is not change in the file system.
If I disable the 'refresh automatically when files change' option in the settings screen the constant refresh is stopped but then I have to refresh manually.

Note: This is almost a duplicate of SRCTREEWIN-2813.  The difference is that issue is marked resolved and this is not resolved. It is either still happening or a regression.

Marked 'Major' because it isn't really Minor that diffs SourceTree is displaying may be wrong with option off, and with it on it keeps scrolling diff view to top of file.

Workaround: Disable feature "Refresh automatically when files change" and manually refresh with Cmd-R key binding. Note: workaround is not a workaround.
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly refreshing: Version 2.3.2 (75)

fields.description:
We are seeing a number of crashes being reported through BugSplat related to using GitHub credentials.

Unfortunately it is not entirely clear where this is happening, it is likely to be in the View/Show Hosted Repositories dialog.

If anyone is able to add any more context and sourcetree.log files it would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Crash using GitHub Credentials

fields.description:
Just trying to get your attention for issue [SRCTREEWIN-2813|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2813], which is classified as "improvement", "cannot reproduce", and "closed". It's seen a fair bit of recent activity, for a reason, and should in fact be be set to "bug", "open", and "unresolved".

Feel free to close this reminder afterwards. Cheers!
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly refreshing log view (resurrected)

fields.description:
My situation is than when I changed many files, and I just want to stage or commit some of them, it is really terrible to find & add files in many files. Search function just can search files I want find, but it doesn't support function like exclude, with this function, I can filter some files I want't to add or commit this time.

So I think it's time to extend search function.
fields.summary: Extend search function in Working Copy

fields.description: If scaling options in Windows a changed to 125% icons an texts placed in wrong positions with wrong sizes
fields.summary: Icons size and text position with 125% scaling

fields.description: SourceTree for Windows is not following the rules specific in the ~/.ssh/config. In this case, the admin team has setup has one user id (git) with multiple keys providing role-based access. I can't make this change in that environment.
fields.summary: Support SSH Config file rules

fields.description: When creating multiple branches, it is difficult to view the hierarchy as the folders do not go to the top of the list. This is really un-intuitive.
fields.summary: Order branches with folders at the top

fields.description:
We recently set up Git-LFS, and we believe this may be related to a recent extreme slowdown in staging/unstaging files. It now takes files several seconds to switch, even those not flagged as Large Files. Staging individual chunks appears to be faster in some instances, even when the only change is a single chunk.

Previously these operations would be nearly instant, and it's difficult to tell whether or not the command actually went through, making Sourcetree much more cumbersome to use.

The issue occurs using both embedded or system Git.
fields.summary: Staging/Unstaging extremely slow - Possibly linked to LFS

fields.description: I entered my credentials for my local Bitbucket server durring the initial setup. SourceTree was not able to login. When I tried to change the password from the account manager, my username was cleared. When I entered my username again, the password was cleared. Rolling back to 1.9.13.7 fixed the issue
fields.summary: Can't login to local BitBucket instance from SourceTree
Alterar cor da bolinha no hover das fotos da clínica

fields.description:
When performing a complex rebase deep into a tree, the operation will occasionally fail due to "index.lock" being present, with a message about another git process in operation.  If the abort-rebase also fails, the repository can be left in an inconsistent state with possible data loss.

I suspect there is a background process in Sourcetree that is using a git command that monitors for changes/etc that remains active during the rebase process, and there is a race condition where sometimes it manages to grab the lock and causes the rebase to fail.  The fix is probably to suspend this process during the rebase and resume afterwards.

To reproduce, select a commit ~15 commits behind the current branch, and select "rebase children of DEADBEEF interactively".  Then squash some of the commits at the bottom, or edit some messages, etc to cause everything above it to be rebased onto the changed commit.

It does not occur every time, but farther back is more likely to cause it to reproduce, so try going farther back if you can't get it to reproduce.

Strangely, the bug does not seem to occur when running a command-line interactive rebase, even if SourceTree is still open (tested once or twice but not thoroughly confirmed)
fields.summary: Complex interactive-rebases fail due to index.lock w/ possible data loss

Cabanha Campo Feliz
intranet

fields.description:
When you have lots of repositories open, it's difficult to know which one is currently active:
 * The active tab isn't particularly visually distinct from the other tabs - the two grey colours are very similar and the tab edges are not shaped to highlight the active one
 * The name gets truncated - even the current tab
 * Sometimes the active tab is not even in the current view (this is the case if you have lots of tabs and you scroll the tab bar, or sometimes if you use a bookmark to activate a tab).
 * The title bar of the app doesn't show the active repository
 * When you hover over a tab, the full title/name doesn't show up. So if you have two similarly-named repos open, you can't tell which is which. The screenshot attached to this request shows this issue.

It would be great if the active tab was marked much more clearly by resolving these issues.

 

Also, great application - keep up the good work!

 

Graeme West
fields.summary: Clearer indication of current repository in tab bar

fields.description:
It would be hugely helpful to have some kind of filter bar for the repository bookmarks list. When you have a large number of repositories saved as bookmarks, it becomes difficult to find particular ones - especially if you've organised them into folders.

Great product - keep up the good work.

Thanks,

Graeme West
fields.summary: Filter for sidebar

fields.description: The text for the [fetch, branch, merge, stash, discard, tag] icons in sourcetree is missing.  There is also no tooltip text to indicate what the icon does.  I have attached a screenshot of the issue.  Restarting sourcetree will fix the icons temporarily.  I have not determined the actions that will result in the text disappearing.
fields.summary: Sourcetree icons are missing text (fetch, branch, merge, stash, discard, tag)

fields.description:
Once you changed your domain's password, the SourceTree will ask for password once. You typed in the new password and it keeps asking for it. If you hit cancel, it will be able to use all the related repos. However, it will:
 # Randomly pops up a window asking you for password again and again even you did nothing on the SourceTree; And / or,
 # Lockout the AD account silently after you clicked the cancel button and let it stay there for a while. (Yes, after cancelling it, it will allow you to use all the related repos! Fetch, pull, push ... everything works)

Today, I got my account locked out again. After asking IT guys to unlock my account for thousands of times, I finally couldn't take it any more. And I went out there to search if there is any solution. And I got this:

[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22653861/sourcetree-keep-asking-password-windows-8.1]

In this ticket, Balazs Szakmary gave a clue about the authentication in Tools\Options\Authentication. I went there and deleted the old password. Now, things went even wrong from already wrong:
 # When I tried to use the related Repos, it just complained failed to authenticate but not pop up window to enter the password.
 # There is no way to add a password in the Tools\Options\Authentication window. I have to quit and reopen the SourceTree.
 # After doing so, it popped up the window for asking password. However, after I typed in the right password, it kept complaining authentication failed.
 # Now, I cannot use these related Repos any more even if I clicked cancel button when it asking me for password.
 # Well, just like before, I did nothing but left the SourceTree out there in the corner, not touching it. And it would suddenly pop up a window asking for the password for no reason. And no doubt, it failed to login even if I typed in the right password.

I tried uninstall the SourceTree and reinstall it again couple of months ago. And it seems to be working. However, I don't believe this is the right way to use a software. And I thought I tried remove the book marks and it didn't work.

 
----
Update1:

Just before I start trying to uninstall and reinstall as I did the last time, it went back to the point which and access the Repos but still pops up window asking for password suddenly and randomly. What I did was nothing but open it, close it, and re-opening it. And I did remember I tried typing my password and it did asking me again about the password as usual. And I again cancelled it but I can't remember what next I did. Maybe I just closed and re-open it. However, it's still not behaving normal.
fields.summary: Keep asking for password but failed to login until lockout AD account

fields.description: It would be a very nice feature to see the amount of commits on the current branch. (E.g. in the top right corner.) --> See the attached image, please.
fields.summary: Showing the amount of commits

fields.description:
# I had Source tree open.
# I perused BitBucket.org on Chrome _version is above in [Environment]_ (after logging in) and found a Mercurial repo I was interested in ([https://seriussoft@bitbucket.org/saluk/pow_quest])
# I copied the path and returned to source tree.
# I opened the [Clone New Repo] sub-modal (_Clone/New_)
# I pasted the path and began to fill out the form to clone it to my hdd from sourcetree app.
# I wasn't sure I copied the repo-url correctly, so I returned to the browser and hit the \[[Clone in SourceTree]\] button in the browser. After proceeding with the popups that would eventually tell SourceTree to load a local clone of that repo, my SourceTree app regains focus and then it crashes with the option to create this bug/ticket.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when using external 'clone' link from browser while in menu
search input in bookmarks tab?
SourceTree checkout of LFS object fails with out of memory
I want the current active repository to be highlighted in the bookmarks window.

fields.description:
Attached video shows that a stash on "bugfix/TT5520-b" stays visible even after the STASHES branch colapse.

The problem dissapeared after ST restart.

Possible culprit: after the stash in question was created, the "bugfix/TT5520-b" branch was merged and deleted locally.
fields.summary: Strange Stash behavior on GUI

fields.description:
Hi, 

For the community that utilizes Git Flow for SourceTree, I've seen a demand for the functionality of also being able to finish the feature on remote as well as locally. 

SourceTree currently finishes a feature by using 
git flow feature finish "featurename" 

But there should also be an option for sending the same command with a Fetch as well, so that it pushes the feature finish to remote. 
git flow feature finish "featurename" -F
fields.summary: Git Flow Finish Feature with Fetch

fields.description:
When i try to push i am getting an error on 2.0.5-alpha-0

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master
error: cannot spawn C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassianlabs\SourceTree.Askpass\SourceTree.Askpass.GitAskpassPassThrough\bin\Debug\st-git-askpass-passthrough.exe: No such file or directory
bash: /dev/tty: No such device or address
error: failed to execute prompt script (exit code 1)
fatal: could not read Username for 'URL HERE': No error
Pushing to "Url"
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: I cant push with 2.0.5-alpha-0

fields.description:
Git LFS 1.5.4 introduces a critical fix for LFS on Windows. Without the fixes in 1.5.4, any repo with files that have commits with binary data for file types identified for storage in LFS cause an error when performing many operation (checkout, etc), preventing users from working with those repositories.

Manually replacing the git-lfs.exe binary in the SourceTree AppData folder will update the LFS version used by SourceTree Win, but SourceTree currently doesn't handle the new warning message issued by LFS when checking out a branch containing a non-LFS file.
fields.summary: Need Support for Git-LFS 1.5.4

fields.description: When I start Sourcetree since one of the latest update, I have to click yes or no to delete some dictionary, this slows down the application startup time, because until I click an answer, the application is not starting and since this is one of the application that takes the longest to load, I like to load it in the background before I need it, but now I have to remember to answer the popup before doing something else.
fields.summary: Popup about dictionary on startup

fields.description:
h3. *Conflicts are impossible to deal with in the file status view.* 

Identical items appear in Staged and Unstaged making it impossible to know what's going on.

!image-2017-01-09-11-18-01-756.png!

 

Then the code view isn't much help either because it shows the text from git eg. <<<<<<< , ==========, >>>>>>>>>>>>>, giving no indication what Staging or Unstaging will do. 

 

!image-2017-01-09-11-21-40-173.png!

Will staging or unstaging resolve this conflict or add the <<<<<<<<< to the commit, breaking your code? Who knows?

Conflicts are the bane of all collaboration and SourceTree is failing at making this process predictable and understandable.

 
h3. *Ideas*

 
 * Don't show two items for each conflict. One is staged one isn't? how is this helpful?
 * Don't show text changes from git. 
 * Show the text changes from git but colorize them better and don't allow commiting the raw conflits text
fields.summary: Conflicts confusing in UI for git

fields.description:
Where are the labels starting with "Fetch"

 

!image-2017-01-09-11-15-22-792.png!
fields.summary: Toolbar buttons missing labels
test1

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users add files larger than 2 MB in an LFS initialised repository, they get the following warning upon staging the file:   !Screen Shot 2017-01-09 at 12.30.55.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to select the file size limit upon which this warning will show.
h3. Why this is important

The warning disrupts the users' workflow, it would be useful for them to have a way to manually adjust the file size limit.
fields.summary: As a user I want to select the file size upon which SourceTree will give "Large files detected" message
Deleted Branch still available in SourceTree

I've crashed my computer doing this feature twice because of this.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While pulling remote branch, _Remote branch to pull_'s dropdown menu intermittently shows incorrect default branch.
It either shows no values or the current checked out local branch instead of the selected remote branch.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # *Right Click* on a Remote branch then click *Pull <Remote-Branch-Name> into current branch*
 # The _Remote branch to pull_'s dropdown menu will show the current branch name instead of the selected remote branch

--STSP-5675
fields.summary: Incorrect default branch shows while pulling remote branch

fields.description:
After entering a valid address in user information and press "Enter", SourceTree prompts _Invalid Email Format_ error even entering a correct email format.

!STEmailAddress.gif!

 
h3. Workaround 
 * Click "OK" instead of pressing *Enter*
 * Update user information manually by navigating to *Tools>Options>General(Tab)*
fields.summary: "Invalid Email Format" error shows when enter a valid email address

see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5591

When I press F5 or click "refresh",  message "loading" is shown and nothing happens.Looks like it's stuck. I have to re-open sourcetree to see commits again.

I have only one git project converted from mercurial project

fields.description: It would be great to be able to sort the files in the upstaged files list on the file status pane.  There does not seem to be any rhyme or reason to the order.
fields.summary: unstaged files sort algorithm

fields.description:
Hi,

 

I sometimes like to use another diff program to see the file differences.  I can set my program in the settings.  However, if I close SourceTree and reopen it, my custom external diff program setting is lost.
fields.summary: External diff setting not saved between sessions

fields.description:
Hi,

 

There is an annoying bug in the latest version of SourceTree.  If I am in the file status pane and select a file to see differences, the stage selected button is initially enabled.  However, as soon as the app does a new scan of the files, the Stage Selected button is disabled even though the file is still selected and the differences are shown.

Button text will sometimes disappear.  Cannot pin down an exact cause to reproduce - simply occurs intermittently while working.  (edit: occurred immediately upon startup today)

Buttons still work normally, and restarting the application fixes them.
fields.summary: Button text will disappear

fields.description:
When pulling from a git repository hosted on bitbucket, which uses git LFS, the operation fails.

Issuing 'git lfs logs last' as instructed by the error message, the following is the output.

As highlighted in bold, it seems there is a problem with moving the downloaded files across different disks.

I suspect this is a problem with either SourceTree or the Bitbucket Media API helper, because if I reset the working copy and then issue a regular 'git pull' from the command line (which uses vanilla lfs and not the Bitbucket media api), then the pull operation completes successfully

fields.description:
The issue is as mentioned on the issue title and below are the sample gif:

!SourceTreePendingPane.gif!
fields.summary: Pending files pane width resets after reloading SourceTree

fields.description:
I have one local server in my office and windows 7 installed on it and assigned IP 192.168.0.6 to it. I have user account created with name "OAdmin" on that server.

I have created GIT repository on that server under  D:/Projects/Project1

Now i have my laptop and windows 10 is installed on it. When i am trying to clone that repository on my laptop using sourcetree with following source path

OAdmin@192.168.0.6:/D/Projects/Project1

but it is showing error as showing in attachment.

someone please look into this ?

Thank you
fields.summary: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The System cannot find the file specified

fields.description:
Unpleasant problem with non-unicode text (comments) in the code. Is it possible to fix it in the next update?

Please see example:

!02-01-2017 21-53-11.jpg!
fields.summary: Visualisation problem with non-unicoce text

fields.description:
When I start SourceTree, the main menu is shown in weird position. See attached screenshot (it's not cropped, that's what is in my top left corner).

It seems to me ST tries to remember position and size of the main window when app is closed, but when reopened it gets confused, because it doesn't remember the window was maximized.
fields.summary: SourceTree main menu gets weirdly positioned

fields.description:
When I try to add hosting account to SourceTree that will use OAuth, after clicking Refresh OAuth Token button, I'm provided with blank page with URL [http://localhost:34106/?code=3041f0933199e8ae1869&state=authenticated]

 

I'm not sure which app should be running on that port 34106 on my machine (netstat didn't show any).
fields.summary: Weird step in OAuth authentization for BitBucket and GitHub

fields.description: During the installation of this version I have chosen to use OAuth for remote servers (BitBucket, GItHub), but when I got to "Starting repository" point of installer I've got error as it's attached.
fields.summary: Using OAuth for remotes causes error during install

fields.description:
New Feature request :

Today we can bookmark repos in the left pane , and even order them by folders, but what is missing ( and should be easy to implement ) is the ability to save the workspace ( especially the bookmarked repos, with respective folders if existing ).

IMHO the ability to bookmark is somewhat nulled without being able to save / export / import - and it would be very useful in a number of cases , including Migration, formatting HD, New machine etc. Even portability . 

In an extreme scenario I could even imagine binding those bookmarks to username - but that is not required. A simple XML that cen be saved, imported etc would be enough.
fields.summary: Ability to save the workspace ( bookmarked repos )

fields.description:
Make a right click onto a changed file and click on the {{External Diff}} command. The result is that absolutely nothing happens.

The expected behaviours is that the external application starts and displays the difference.
fields.summary: 'External Diff' does not work

fields.description: Happens when in the "commit" view, choosing files to stage.  I will click on a file to see the changes made.  After a few seconds, it will blink as if it refreshed the file to load any changes, even though nothing has changed for a while.  The "stage selected" button gets disabled, and to actually stage what I want, I have to select a different file and then come back to the first.  Can happen multiple times in a row.  I have the terminal open to the repo as well, if that affects anything.
fields.summary: Commit view refreshes frequently, disabling "stage selected" button
I was trying to install the source tree in my system.however i was getting the error as unable to extract portablHG.7z
SourceTree Windows Process consuming 5 GB of Memory
Dark UI color scheme

fields.description:
# Ensure that split view staging is enabled.
 # Stage a file.
 # Click the newly staged file and observe that the diff is visible in the window to the right.
 # Press F5 to refresh SourceTree.
 # Observe that the diff has disappeared.

This happens whenever SourceTree refreshes (i.e. when a file is modified on the file system) not just when F5 is pressed.

!stbug.png!
fields.summary: Diff window is blank when a staged file is selected and SourceTree refreshes

fields.description:
# Ensure that "Split view staging" is active.
 # Ensure that there are some unstaged files in the "Unstaged files" window.
 # Select a file in the "Unstaged files" window and observe that the "Stage Selected" button is enabled.
 # Press F5 to refresh.
 # Observe that the "Stage Selected" button is disabled.

This also happens when SourceTree automatically refreshes due to changes to the filesystem. This is super annoying when trying to stage a file, because it means you have to select another file then re-select the original file in order to re-enable the button.
fields.summary: "Stage Selected" is disabled after refreshing with F5

fields.description:
File watcher will return "touched" files even if diff does not actually identify any changes in file.

To reproduce: touch a watched file, select in viewer, no changes will appear.

Staging a selected file will not move file to top of stage.
fields.summary: File watcher shows "changed" file even if diff does not identify any changes

fields.description:
On the commit stage, the "commit" button sometimes is enabled but does nothing even if there are changes staged/etc.  I have not been able to localize the bug any further than this, so I do not have steps to reproduce.  It simply appears after using the app for some time and staging some hunks or files.

Sometimes (perhaps always?) the commit message disappears.

Restarting the app fixes the problem.
fields.summary: Commit stage: "commit" button sometimes does nothing

fields.description:
When performing a shift-select of multiple lines of code to add to the stage, if you select from bottom to top the last selection line will move downwards 1 row and leave a row blank.

Steps to reproduce:
 #  Change files on disk
 # Go to the commit stage (split-view) and select the file.
 # Select last changed line.
 # Shift-select to top changed line
 # Last selected line will jump

----------------

 

REGRESSION in 1.9.10.0
fields.summary: Commit stage: Line selection splays on shift-select

fields.description:
Feature Request: please add a button to launch an external diff .
 It seems that we can launch an external diff tool selecting the menu item or pressing control + D.
 But it is not easy to use.

(By the way, Affects Version/s field in this page should be sorted.)
fields.summary: Feature Request: a button to launch an external diff tool

fields.description:
As mentioned in the title, SourceTree executes Git for every few second without performing any Git operation.
h4. Investigation done
 # Uncheck _Check default remotes for updates_ and _Refresh automatically when files change_
 # Reinstall _SourceTree_
 # Remove all bookmark and __ reclone the new repository

Outcome: The issue still persists

 

STSP-5366
fields.summary: Git is being executed every few second without performing any action
Unable to open SourceTree

fields.description:
If I create a patch from 2 (or more) commits and I apply it, they appear in the reverse order.

See: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/30946697/source-tree-patch-order-of-commits]
fields.summary: Reverse commit order in Apply Patch commits

fields.description:
When on the commit stage split view, select a file and commit several hunks (but not all hunks).  Then select the file in the "staged" portion of the split-view.  Click "unstage hunk".  The file selection will jump from the "staged" area to the "unstaged" area.  

The hunk will not be removed from the list of staged hunks, and the "unstage hunk" controls will remain.  Clicking them again will do nothing further.  Reselecting the file in the "staged files" area, the hunk will remain.  Clicking "unstage hunk" again does nothing.
fields.summary: Clicking "unstage hunk" causes file selection to jump to "unstaged" list of files

fields.description: When the commit message is very long (eg right after a big merge with lots of conflicts, as in the example), the text box on the commit stage becomes so big that you cannot see the file lists or the commit controls.
fields.summary: Commit stage: long messages fill window and obscure UI

fields.description:
a popup asks the user to delete 

invalid dictionary file references

 

and referres to them,  but the referral is totally missing -

 

how is the user to decide wheher or not to delete the dictionaries? 

 

totally  dysfunctional sourcetree warning  message , see screenshot 

 

 

 this alert comes up due to serious performance issues, caused by sourcetree,  but the user is still unable to delete the dictionaries, as he remains in the blind about WHICH files are concerned - that happens ofen, but should never  happen
fields.summary: dysfunctional sourcetree warning  message

fields.description:
As far as I remember, this bug was present since first 1.9 releases.

Steps:
 # Open a repository (Git, for example).
 # Commit some changes with some commit message.
 # Click on button with "clock" to see previous commit messages - latest commit message is not present in the opened list.
 # Restart SourceTree, click on the same button - commit message from step 2 now is present in the list of latest commits.

 

I can provide logs if necessary.
fields.summary: Commit messages are not saved until SourceTree is restarted

fields.description:
TL;DR: If the user.config file gets corrupted, SourceTree 1.9.6.1 will not start.

 

I tried to put details in my question [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44095261]

 

Copy/pate:

 

My PC (running Win 10 with latest updates) shut down hard from a sudden power off (human error).

I click on the SourceTree icon and it does ... nothing. No message. Just no start. I click on the icon, get the busy symbol for a moment, and nothing.

I did a complete uninstall and install with the latest SourceTree 1.9.6.1 with no change in behavior.

 

I was eventually able to solve the problem with the following (again, copy/paste):

 

I found that the file

 
|\Users\<username>AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_Url_<randomstring>\1.9.6.1\user.config|

was corrupted. Instead of being full of XML, most of the file was full of zeroes (0x00).

 

I copied the user.config file from the 1.9.6.0 sibling directory. I've lost some settings but SourceTree is working again.
fields.summary: Corrupted user.config file prevents SourceTree from starting.

fields.description:
Customer's report:

{quote}
SourceTree has become non responsive now that I have many projects. I have 27 repositories and when I open it up, I wait for a long time to make sure all the 'refresh' icons are gone for each project. But even then if I can get a project tab to open up, I can't click anywhere and eventually it will just crash.
{quote}

It does not crash after removing the bookmarks and tabs by deleting them in this files:

C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\opentabs.xml
C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\bookmarks.xml

However, it is not a long term solution as the user needs to open up the 27 repositories again.
fields.summary: Having many repositories opened up in SourceTree can cause it to be unusable.
